last_episode_to_air.name: Oops, a Daisy
last_episode_to_air.overview: Polly and the Major get in an arguement over his birthday gift to Casey, a Daisy rifle. But who eventually wins the fight?

name: Major Dad
overview: Major Dad is an American sitcom created by Richard C. Okie and John G. Stephens, developed by Earl Pomerantz, that originally ran from 1989 to 1993 on CBS, starring Gerald McRaney as Major John D. MacGillis and Shanna Reed as his wife Polly. The cast also includes Beverly Archer, Matt Mulhern, Jon Cypher, Marisa Ryan, Nicole Dubuc and Chelsea Hertford.

episodes.name: Major Dad
episodes.overview: Polly writes a distressing article on the Marines.  The Major sets out to prove her wrong, and they fall in love.

episodes.name: Just Polly & Me, and the Kids Make Five
episodes.overview: The Major proposes, but Polly's daughters must approve.

episodes.name: Rescue Mission
episodes.overview: Major Smiley, an old pal, tries to dissuade the Major from marriage.

episodes.name: Wedding
episodes.overview: An alert on the base interrupts the Major and Polly's wedding day.

episodes.name: Wounded Flyboy and the Nurse Who Gave Him Reason to Live
episodes.overview: The Major and Polly have trouble finding time together because of their busy schedules.

episodes.name: Twinkle
episodes.overview: Polly asks the Major to straighten things out when Elizabeth falls for Lt. Holowachuk.

episodes.name: Jane Wayne Day
episodes.overview: Polly endures a survival-training day for Marine wives.

episodes.name: Robin's Awakening
episodes.overview: A long-distance chess match comes to town for the final battle and it turns out that a young teen sparks an interest in boys for Robin.

episodes.name: Major Mom
episodes.overview: Polly  goes to jail to protect a news source.

episodes.name: Love Doctor
episodes.overview: Sgt. James decides to pursue a career as a radio personality instead of re-enlisting.

episodes.name: See the Hill ... Over the Hill
episodes.overview: The Major worries he may be over the hill and challenges a reluctant Holowachuk to a martial arts rematch.

episodes.name: Boxer Rebellion
episodes.overview: The Major and Polly disagree about the dress code at Elizabeth's school. The Major says change the schoolboard, and Polly says change the rules and she helps Elizabeth protest.

episodes.name: Discipline
episodes.overview: The Major and Polly think of how to punish Casey for losing one of The Major's medals.

episodes.name: Lemon
episodes.overview: Clashing lifestyles send the family to a counselor after the Major dumps the girls' dead pet bird.

episodes.name: That Connell Woman
episodes.overview: An old girlfriend and Lt. Colonel has romantic designs on the Major.

episodes.name: Jr.
episodes.overview: Polly has morning sickness and gives the Major hopes of fatherhood.

episodes.name: Major Coach
episodes.overview: Hard feelings arise after Polly ask the Major to coach Robin's basketball team.  Lt. Holowachuk buys an expensive camera from a beautiful woman and the Major suspects she is a con artist.

episodes.name: Camp MacGillis
episodes.overview: The Major takes th family on a camping trip.

episodes.name: Not with My Daughter You Don't
episodes.overview: The Major becomes an overprotective father when Elizabeth's new boyfriend Chip becomes more serious.

episodes.name: Officer of the Day
episodes.overview: Lt. Holowachuk gets in trouble when he plans a secret country hoe-down birthday party for the Major.

episodes.name: All Quiet on the Home Front, pt. 1
episodes.overview: The Major is put on alert for a top-secret mission

episodes.name: All Quiet on the Home Front, pt. 2
episodes.overview: The Major's family welcomes him back, but he thinks they resent his job.

episodes.name: See the Bridge
episodes.overview: After returning safely from combat, Lt. Holowachuk craves danger.

episodes.name: Standing Tall
episodes.overview: Casey takes the Major's advice on how to handle a bully.

episodes.name: Face the Music ... and Dance, pt. 1
episodes.overview: The Major takes a job offer to be transferred to Camp Hollister in Virginia.

episodes.name: Face the Music ... and Dance, pt. 2
episodes.overview: The Major decides to quite the Corps.

episodes.name: Safe at First Base
episodes.overview: The Major adjusts to his new post at Camp Hollister, where the General's grandson takes pictures of Polly.

episodes.name: Welcome to Hollister
episodes.overview: The camp prepares for the Vice President's airplane refueling stop, which General Craig makes the Major in charge of.

episodes.name: Get a Job
episodes.overview: Polly gets a job at a newspaper on the base, "The Bulldog," writing the human interest stories.

episodes.name: The Goat
episodes.overview: A news story lies about her baseball team's playoff loss to Robin.

episodes.name: First Anniversary
episodes.overview: Gunny baby-sits on the Major and Polly's first anniversary.

episodes.name: Wetting Down
episodes.overview: In opposition to Marine traditions, Holowachuk does not want alcohol at his wetting down to celebrate making 1st Lieutenant. The Major tries to find a solution.

episodes.name: Infant-ry
episodes.overview: Casey goes overboard to get the Major's attention and becomes a   mini-Marine.

episodes.name: Birthday Ball
episodes.overview: The major needs a guest of honor for a base celebration of the Corps' 215th anniversary, and Vice President Quayle responds to the invitation. It is also Elizabeth's 16th birthday, and she feels neglected.

episodes.name: Wish You Were Here
episodes.overview: The Major tries to be spontaneous by taking the family on a last-minute trip to Hawaii.

episodes.name: Love on the Run
episodes.overview: Lt. Holowachuk and his blind date make immediate wedding plans.

episodes.name: Operation Fun Run
episodes.overview: A hospital visit prevents the Major from completing a Navy Relief fund-raising project, so Gunny and Lt. Holowachuk must see it through.

episodes.name: Gift of the Major
episodes.overview: Casey's much-wanted toy goes to a needy child.

episodes.name: Flying Solo
episodes.overview: The Major anticipates a relaxing weekend when Polly takes the girls shopping.

episodes.name: A Bird in the Hand
episodes.overview: The Major wants Gunny to express her anger after he accidentally   destroys her favorite possession, a ceramic eagle once owned by   the Corps' most decorated Marine.

episodes.name: Learning to Drive
episodes.overview: During a driving lesson with the Major, Elizabeth hits the general's antique MG.

episodes.name: The Name is Over Here
episodes.overview: The Major and his family react to the start of the Persian Gulf War by settling a territorial dispute at home.

episodes.name: Valentine's Day
episodes.overview: The Major is embarrassed by Polly's valentine tribute to him in the base newspaper when it reveals his romantic side in the article; Elizabeth finally agrees to a date with Jesse.

episodes.name: Sins of the Father
episodes.overview: The Major tries to make amends for stealing a watch as a boy.

episodes.name: The Possible Dream
episodes.overview: The officers organize a Marine talent show.  The general, who no one thinks has talent, wants to perform and has to sing at the last minute; Robin runs for president of her student council.

episodes.name: Private Affair
episodes.overview: Elizabeth's new beau is a practical-joking Marine the Major doesn't like.

episodes.name: Polly's Choice
episodes.overview: Polly is asked to collaborate on a book with her former boyfriend, Evan Charters.

episodes.name: Silent Drill Team
episodes.overview: The Major realizes his dream of performing with the Marine Corps   Silent Drill Team.

episodes.name: Elmo Come Home
episodes.overview: Gunny reluctantly dog-sits a homeless puppy the Major hopes to adopt for Casey but becomes attached to it.

episodes.name: Together
episodes.overview: The Major is charged with writing a speech welcoming troops home from Saudi Arabia.  He also decides he wants to adopt Polly's kids, but Elizabeth is reluctant.

episodes.name: The Shut Down
episodes.overview: Defense cutbacks threaten Camp Hollister.

episodes.name: Major Moonlighting
episodes.overview: The Major moonlights as an attendant at the service station   Holowachuk manages.

episodes.name: Polly's Pen Pal
episodes.overview: Robin's smitten penpal, Lt. Vickers, arrives and learns she   sent him a picture of Polly.

episodes.name: A Few Good Men
episodes.overview: The Major is chosen to represent Camp Hollister on a calendar   depicting ideal servicemen.

episodes.name: Poker Night
episodes.overview: General Craig orders his staff to have a night of fun to boost   sagging morale.

episodes.name: Anything You Can Do I Can Do Perky
episodes.overview: Gunny suspects the motives of the perky sergeant the General assigns to assist her.

episodes.name: Educating Casey
episodes.overview: The Major and Polly succumb to the pressure when Casey is chosen   to apply for an accelerated school, which means interviews and tests.

episodes.name: Lady in Waiting
episodes.overview: When Elizabeth is hired as a waitress, Polly and the Major object to her provocative uniform (short, fluffy black dress, white apron and pig ears) which leads Elizabeth to organize a revolt at work.

episodes.name: General Unrest
episodes.overview: The General moves in with the MacGillises when his wife throws him out.

episodes.name: Steel Magnolia
episodes.overview: A lobbyist stages a protest over cutbacks in civilian personnel at the base.

episodes.name: On the Line
episodes.overview: The Marines take over for civilian employees who strike to protest cutbacks at the base.

episodes.name: The Shell Game
episodes.overview: A land developer's plan to build a mall on the site of Camp Hollister is thwarted by a nesting turtle.

episodes.name: Who's That Blonde ?
episodes.overview: Gunny dyes her hair blond after the bill allowing women to be in combat fails; Lt. Holowachuk spruces up his "space."

episodes.name: We've Got Trouble
episodes.overview: Lt. Holowachuk and Gunny get competitive at pool.

episodes.name: Three's a Crowd
episodes.overview: Casey's new boyfriend likes hanging out with the Major.

episodes.name: Three Angry Marines
episodes.overview: Gunny, Holowachuk, and the Major are assigned to a court-martial panel but have different opinions about the case.

episodes.name: Close Encounters
episodes.overview: The MacGillises participate in a marriage workshop during a weekend getaway.

episodes.name: Base Desires
episodes.overview: The MacGillises vie with another family to be military family of   the year.

episodes.name: When Gunny Talks
episodes.overview: Gunny gives successful investment tips to Elizabeth, who then becomes concerned only with making money.

episodes.name: The L Word
episodes.overview: Elizabeth falls for her tutor; Gunny's beau says too much.

episodes.name: Sick Bay
episodes.overview: The Major writes an article on raising children for a bedridden Polly that doesn't sit well with her.

episodes.name: Charlotte's Web
episodes.overview: An "adopt-a-Marine" program pairs Holowachuk with a wild woman.

episodes.name: The Noisy Drill Team
episodes.overview: Gen. Craig prepares the base for inspection by the closure committee.

episodes.name: In the Brick of Time
episodes.overview: Polly prepares an upbeat documentary on Camp Hollister's closing.

episodes.name: The People's Choice, pt. 1
episodes.overview: The visit of the Major's father, Jake, creates tension.

episodes.name: The People's Choice, pt. 2
episodes.overview: Jake moves in with Lt. Holowachuk after a fight with the Major.

episodes.name: Here's Looking at You, Pol
episodes.overview: Revealing old photos of mayoral candidate Polly hit the papers.

episodes.name: Catered Affair
episodes.overview: The Major must hire Elizabeth to cater a reception for a visiting general.

episodes.name: There's No Place Like Farlow
episodes.overview: Casey has a fever and Oz-like nightmares on Halloween.

episodes.name: The Election Show
episodes.overview: The Major takes a leave of absence and goes with Polly on the   election trail when she runs for mayor.

episodes.name: Gunny's Veiled Threat
episodes.overview: Gunny joins the Secret Service and becomes a harem member to guard a visiting emir.

episodes.name: One for the Road
episodes.overview: Fearing a crash, Elizabeth won't drive her new car; Gen. Craig is on crutches and creating havoc with them.

episodes.name: Blue Tenant Holowachuk
episodes.overview: Apartment manager Lt. Holowachuk backs a rent strike against the   landlord: Gen. Craig.

episodes.name: Old Acquaintance
episodes.overview: A change in her college friends disturbs Polly.

episodes.name: About Face
episodes.overview: Everyone jumps to conclusions about Gen. Craig's activities.

episodes.name: I'll Be Seeing You
episodes.overview: Polly is enlisted to be hostess of the '40s-themed USO ball, where new and old loves are sparked.

episodes.name: Night School
episodes.overview: Gen. Craig and the Major go to night school.

episodes.name: Piano Lesson
episodes.overview: The Major is embarrassed about taking piano lessons.

episodes.name: Come Rain or Come Shine
episodes.overview: A corporate headhunter woos several marines.

episodes.name: Colonel of Truth
episodes.overview: After being denied a promotion, the Major considers leaving the   Marines.

episodes.name: From Russia with Like
episodes.overview: The major and a visiting Russian officer compete.

episodes.name: The Spell of Grease Paint
episodes.overview: Polly's role in a play opposite Lt. Holowachuk makes the Major   jealous.

episodes.name: Gunny Gets Robbed
episodes.overview: Gunny's apartment is robbed.

episodes.name: Conduct Unbecoming
episodes.overview: The Major suspects Robin's new boyfriend may be battered by his   father, another major, despite denials from the family; Lt.   Holowachuk tries to fill his basketball team but finds complications when Gen. Craig wants to play--and no one wants to guard him because he is the general.

episodes.name: General Disturbance
episodes.overview: General Craig is transferred to the White House.

episodes.name: Oops, a Daisy
episodes.overview: Polly and the Major get in an arguement over his birthday gift to Casey, a Daisy rifle. But who eventually wins the fight?
